result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Romare Lynn Campbell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Romare Lynn Campbell in court.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Romare Lynn Campbell.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  

Court addressed defense's bail motion.  Court will allow supervised visitation with third party contact through the victim's mother, if the victim agrees Case is adjourned to Branch 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and Filed. Defense Motion to Modify Bond

Court is in trial and unable to hear this case.  Defendant appeared in person.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Romare Lynn Campbell not in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn appeared by video for Romare Lynn Campbell.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Preliminary Hearing unable to proceed due to court congestion. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Romare Lynn Campbell not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

Defendant Romare Lynn Campbell not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State request that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied.   Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with PBT, SSR.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL ISSUES: 
 Defendant Romare Lynn Campbell in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Romare Lynn Campbell in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY IF OUT OF CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
